title: Selma Blair reveals what it's like to play Kris Jenner in American Crime Story
text:
Selma Blair reveals what it's like to play Kris Jenner in American Crime Story Selma Blair reveals what it's like to play Kris Jenner in American Crime Story Share 
Selma Blair has revealed that playing Kris Jenner comes naturally to her because of “Kardashian osmosis”. 
The Cruel Intentions star is taking on the role of Kris in American Crime Story, an anthology TV series that looks at some of America’s most notorious crimes, including football star OJ Simpson’s murder trial. Selma at the 2015 Operation Smile Gala (John Salangsang/AP) 
Kris was married to Simpson’s defence lawyer Robert Kardashian, who became nationally recognised in America during Simpson’s 1995 criminal trial for the murder of his ex-wife Nicole Brown and waiter Ronald Lyle Goldman. The couple were close friends of Simpson and Brown. 
Their four children – Kim, Kourtney, Khloe and Rob – are now some of the most famous reality TV stars in the world. Kris with her boyfriend Corey Gamble (Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP) 
Friends star David Schwimmer is taking on the role of Robert Kardashian in the highly anticipated series, while Cuba Gooding Jr will play Simpson. John Travolta, Sarah Paulson, Connie Britton and Nathan Lane are also set to star in the drama. 
“Kris Jenner is such an iconic character now that you really don’t have to do anything to prepare,” said Selma. “I mean I talked to her but it’s playing her in the 90s and it just came naturally. Maybe I just have subliminal Kardashian-Jenner in my brain all the time. I think anyone could play her, but I like her very much.” Promoted stories David Schwimmer is playing Kris’s late husband Robert Kardashian (Evan Agostini/Invision/AP) 
She added: “It’s Kardashian osmosis, I think we all have it now.” 
Speaking on the red carpet at a gala in Beverly Hills for Operation Smile, a charity that provides free surgery for children around the world suffering from facial deformities, the 43-year-old actress said: “I think it’s wonderful when even a small amount of celebrity as mine can really raise awareness for such a big cause. That is when I love to get in front of the cameras and that is when I love to talk about anything to do with children and making their lives and their parents’ lives easier. Selma with her Universal Smile Award (John Salangsang/AP) 
“Operation Smile has always been an organisation that puts the money right there to help the children and volunteers and it saves their lives, not just their smiles.” 
Selma, who is mother to four-year-old son Arthur, received the Universal Smile Award at the gala and said her little boy gives her reason to smile every day. 
“Of course my son, I think every mother says that. My son and my friends who are with me tonight who will take a night out of their lives to give me hugs.” Share article 
American Crime Story is set to air in the United States in 2016. Promoted Stories
